pullRequest.body:
- Add a constructor `TwoSidedIdeal.ofIdeal` to turn an `Ideal` that happens to be two-sided into a `TwoSidedIdeal`.
- Use `ofIdeal` to define a two-sided version of the Jacobson radical.
- Generalize some ring lemmas that didn't need to assume commutativity.
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ asIdeal_jacobson`
`+ asIdeal_toTwoSided`
`+ coe_mk'`
`+ coe_toTwoSided`
`+ exists_mul_add_sub_mem_of_mem_jacobson`
`+ instance : CanLift (Ideal R) (TwoSidedIdeal R) TwoSidedIdeal.asIdeal`
`+ jacobson`
`+ jacobson_mul_mem_right`
`+ mem_toTwoSided`
`+ toTwoSided`
`+ toTwoSided_asIdeal`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by j-loreaux.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11174148046/job/31063349954)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11174148046/job/31063349699)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
maintainer merge
maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

These could potentially be packaged as `TwoSidedIdeal R â‰ƒo { I : Ideal R // mul_mem_right }`. However, I am not sure when (if ever) one would want to use that subtype instead of just `TwoSidedIdeal`.
Should the `mem_blah` lemmas be `@[simp]`?
This seems like a good one to be simp
Is there a mathlib name for this construction?
This looks like it's the `Submodule.comap` by `DistribMulAction.toLinearMap` applied to `MulOpposite R`.
Thanks! Indeed this worked. I'm not sure it's a change for the better, but it does make the proof shorter. I left a comment explaining what the set actually is.
Why the change to the variable names?

The change to names is inconsequential (though I do think it's more readable not to have so many letters in the statement), but the change to their _types_ (namely, omitting the types and letting Lean infer them) is what let me simplify the proof of `mem_ker`. The difference in types is just whether something is eta-expanded, but the new version allows Lean to infer them and the previous one didn't.

I guess the eta expanding could be avoided by writing `@one_mem` etc instead, but your version is certainly easier to read. The fact that eta-expansions are performed (presumably thanks to implicit lambdas) is quite surprising to me.

I would prefer to keep the names, please. Reasoning: `mk'` should actually be the default method for defining a `TwoSidedIdeal`, and users will probably need to apply `mem_mk'` soon thereafter. It would be a shame if they had to read the actual types of the hypotheses in order to do so, as opposed to just seeing the names and knowing intuitively what they are.
I readded the names, though I don't think anybody should be providing these arguments manually: they should be filled in by unification.
And this one as well.

or switch the order of the equality.
```suggestion
lemma asIdeal_jacobson (I : TwoSidedIdeal R) : asIdeal I.jacobson = (asIdeal I).jacobson := by
```

I think that this name is not meaningfully different from `fromIdeal` (i.e., without checking the types, I won't know which one is which). I think `_root_.Ideal.toTwoSided` or `_root_.Ideal.toTwoSidedIdeal` would be better. I realize that this name might also suffer slightly from the problem I just mentioned *but*, unlike `fromIdeal`, which can't take advantage of dot notation because it's an order hom, this declaration can do so. This could be the distinguishing feature.

Obviously lemmas below would need to be renamed too, and I'm open to other suggestions here.

I agree that having dot notation work is nice. For that reason, should `fromIdeal` also live in the `Ideal` namespace, and perhaps be renamed to `Ideal.twoSidedSpan` or something like that (in another PR!)?
I could be wrong, but this was my point in the first comment: dot notation won't work for that one because it's an order homomorphism.
Maybe renaming it to `TwoSidedIdeal.spanIdeal` would make sense though.
Please add a docstring pointing the user to `TwoSidedIdeal.jacobson` with a statement that they should prefer that when the ideal is two-sided.

I found that [this unmerged mathlib3 PR](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/pull/13862/files#diff-d50d7dee9b427f9710e98cc536adfd95f656e65f85f1ac179cd465c399375551R128-R129) actually contains this result (in the special case `I = 0`, but the proof probably generalizes, or else consider the quotient R/I).
Do you think anything from that PR should still be added to mathlib4, or are we happy with the API added here?
I'll work on a proof that IsArtinianRing implies IsNoetherianRing starting tomorrow; we'll see what else I need.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory): define two-sided Jacobson radical
